types.name: AuditableData
types.description: At the basic level, a place where items of a particular data type are stored. What would usually be called a field, an attribute or a property. May also be a higher level grouping of AuditableData like a record, object or database row.

code.label: Code
code.description: The unique code for this data attribute. This should be the attribue name in lower case with words separated by hyphens, e.g. billing-country.

name.label: Name
name.description: This item's human readable name, e.g. Billing Country. Ideally this should match your underlying data store name, but if the userlying database name is something obscure like CustomField5 then please use something meaningful and explain in the description.

description.label: Description
description.description: A description of what this data item stores. Please be specific - i.e. say that it's the country that a user is resident in for tax purposes rather than just country.

isInstanceOf.label: InstanceOf
isInstanceOf.description: What type of data is this?

isUpdatedBy.label: UpdatedBy
isUpdatedBy.description: Systems that update this data item.

types.name: AuditableDataType
types.description: The type of AuditableData. A grouping for the domain of values that a AuditableData may take.

code.label: Code
code.description: The unique code for this data type. This should be the type's name hyphenated in lower case, e.g. iso3-country-code.

name.label: Name
name.description: The data type's name, e.g. Royal Mail Postcode or SIC Industry.

description.label: Description
description.description: A description of what this data item stores. Please be specific - i.e. say that it's a six-digit SIC classification not just that it's an industry code.

isInstanceOf.label: InstancesOf
isInstanceOf.description: Things that are of this type.

valuesGovernedBy.label: ValuesGovernedBy
valuesGovernedBy.description: The team responsible for deciding what acceptable values for this type are, and for keeping that range of values up-to-date.

types.name: BusinessCapability
types.description: Some business function carried out at FT e.g. ability to publish the news, ability to pay staff...

code.label: Code
code.description:
The unique identification code for the capability. When creating a new capability,
choose a lower case, hyphenated string similar to the name people call the capability.

name.label: Name
name.description: The name generally used to refer to the capability.

description.label: Description
description.description: Brief description of what the cabability is.

importance.label: Inportance
importance.description: The level of importance/criticality of the capability.

dependencies.label: Dependencies
dependencies.description: The systems the capability directly depends on to be fulfilled.

productDependencies.description: The products the capability directly depends on to be fulfilled.
productDependencies.label: Product dependencies

capabilityDependencies.description: Other business capabilities this capability depends on to be fulfilled.
capabilityDependencies.label: Capability dependencies

dependentCapabilities.description: Other business capabilities that depend on this capability.
dependentCapabilities.label: Capability dependents

types.name: Cookie
types.description: A small packet of information sent by a web host to your computer when you visit a website.

description.label: Description
description.description: Short description of what the cookie does and data it stores.

provider.label: Provider
provider.description: Team/person or provider who set the cookie.

hasCookieInstanceOf.label: Cookie instance data
hasCookieInstanceOf.description: Cookie instance data for times cookie has been found on audit of product / domain.

main.heading: Main properties
main.description: These are all essential to fill out.

types.name: CookieInstance
types.description: A node with cookie relationship data specific to a cookie attached to a domain/product website. Data includes cookie path and last seen date.

code.label: Code
code.description: Unique code for this record, an amalgamation of the cookie name and domain it's found on.

path.label: Path
path.description: The path the cookie is set on.

lastSeen.label: Date last seen
lastSeen.description: Date Cookie last found during audit of product / website Audit.

product.label: Product
product.description: The product / website the cookie is found on.

expiry.label: Session or Persistent Cookie
expiry.description: Information taken from cookie audit confirming if cookie found as a session or persistent cookie at time of last audit.

isInstanceOfCookie.label: Cookie details
isInstanceOfCookie.description: Information about what the cookie is for, taken from cookiepedia.

main.heading: Main properties
main.description: These are all essential to fill out.

types.name: CostCentre
types.description: A financial cost centre which pays for the budget of one or more groups

code.label: Code
code.description: The upper case code of this cost centre.

name.label: Name
name.deprecationReason: Ends up always being the same as code, and most of our systems default to using code as name anyway.
name.description: The name of the cost centre.

description.label: Description
description.description: Details of what this cost centre is intended to be used to pay for.

groups.label: FT Group
groups.description: The groups whose budgets are paid for (partly or in full) by this cost centre.

types.name: Group
types.description: An overarching group, responsible for an area of the FT's activities, which contains teams and is costed separately

code.label: Code
code.description:
The unique identification code for the group. When creating a new group,
choose a lower case, hyphenated string similar to the name people call the group.

name.label: Name
name.description: The official name of the group.

description.label: Description
description.description: A description of what the group's areas of responsibility and activities are.

isActive.label: Active
isActive.description: Whether or not the group still exists.

costCentre.label: Cost Centre
costCentre.description: The cost centre that pays for this groups's budget.

techDirector.label: Tech Director
techDirector.description: The technical director for the group.

productOwner.label: Product Owner
productOwner.description: The product owner for the group.

deliveryManager.label: Delivery Manager
deliveryManager.description: The delivery manager for the group.

okrLink.label: OKR Link
okrLink.description: A url linking to the Objectives & Key Results this group is currently focusing on.

topLevelTeams.label: Top level teams
topLevelTeams.description:
The top level teams that form the main subdivisions of the group. In
groups that are too small to have a hierarchical structure, this may
list all the groups teams.

allTeams.label: All teams
allTeams.description:
All the teams that are part of this group. This is populated by traversing
the team hierarchy in the group and the list does not need to be manually
maintained.

types.name: Healthcheck
types.description: The configuration used to provide monitoring/healthchecks for a system.

code.label: Code
code.description: The unique identification code for the healthcheck. When creating a new healthcheck, choose a lower case, hyphenated string either similar to the url of the healthcheck, or briefly describing what it checks, e.g. my-system-us-east-1-health.

isLive.label: Surface results to our Operations Support team?
isLive.description:
All our production systems which are used by any customer (internal or external)
should be shown to Operations Support. Reasons for not showing it include
lower environments (e.g. test or staging) or a product which hasn't yet been
launched to any customers.
isLive.falseLabel: Not yet needed by Operations Support

url.label: URL of the healthcheck endpoint
url.description: The full URL of the endpoint. You should include the "__health" part of the url, if relevant.

monitors.label: Monitored systems
monitors.description: The systems which the healthcheck monitors.

types.name: Package
types.description: A library, component, toolkit or other group of code which can be used by systems.

code.label: Code
code.description: The unique identification for this package. The format is defined as `ecosystem:publishedPackageName`. For example npm:@financial-times/blah or composer:foo.

name.label: Name
name.description: The short name for the package which will be output on screens and reports.

description.label: Description
description.description:
A brief overview of what the package does and why, from the user's perspective.
Note that multiple paragraphs and other markdown features are not supported in this field.

repositories.deprecationReason: Replaced by repository, which has a singular name befitting this one-to-one relationship
repositories.label: Source code repositories
repositories.description: The repositories which store this package's source code and/or configuration.

repository.label: Source code repositories
repository.description: The repository which stores this package's source code and/or configuration.

maintainedBy.label: Maintained by team
maintainedBy.description: The team which maintained the package.

types.name: Person
types.description: A member of staff at the FT, or a contact from a relevant third party. FT staff members' details are imported daily from https://who.in.ft.com, so manual additions/updates are not needed.

code.label: Code
code.description:
The unique code for this person. For FT staff this will be their active directory name.
For third parties, please use firstname.lastname.company.

name.label: Name
name.description:
The name by which this person is known.
For FT staff, if details are incorrect please raise this in the \#ip-people-api slack channel.

email.label: Email
email.description:
The email address that can be used to contact this person.
For FT staff, if details are incorrect please raise this in the \#ip-people-api slack channel.

slack.label: Slack
slack.description:
The Slack link for this person (deprecated).
For FT staff, if details are incorrect please raise this in the \#ip-people-api slack channel.

slackName.label: Slack Name
slackName.description:
The Slack name for this person.
For FT staff, if details are incorrect please raise this in the \#ip-people-api slack channel.

slackID.label: Slack ID
slackID.description:
The Slack id for this person.
For FT staff, if details are incorrect please raise this in the \#ip-people-api slack channel.

githubName.label: Github Username
githubName.description: The Github user name for this person.

phone.label: Phone
phone.description:
The telephone number that can be used to contact this person.
For FT staff, if details are incorrect please raise this in the \#ip-people-api slack channel.

isPeopleApi.label: Is FT staff
isPeopleApi.description:
Whether or not this person is an FT staff member listed in https://people-finder.in.ft.com/.
Please raise in the \#ip-people-api slack channel if details are incorrect.

isActive.label: Active
isActive.description:
Whether or not this person is still working at the FT.
For FT staff, if details are incorrect please raise this in the \#ip-people-api slack channel.

contract.label: Contract type
contract.description:
The type of employment contract this Person has with the FT.
For FT staff, if details are incorrect please raise this in the \#ip-people-api slack channel.

source.label: Source
source.description: The primary data source used to provide information for this person - Workday, Salesforce, ldap, github, Slack or multiple.

proposedId.label: Proposed ID
proposedId.deprecationReason: Only needed during migration to new ids
proposedId.description: The ID of this person in Workday, ldap, github or Slack. If no ID is found, it is `name.lastname`.

techDirectorFor.label: Tech director for group
techDirectorFor.description: The group(s) this person is a Technical Director for.

productOwnerFor.label: Product owner for group
productOwnerFor.description: The group(s) who own the systems this person drives the business aspects of.

deliveryManagerFor.label: Delivery manager for group
deliveryManagerFor.description: The group(s) who own the systems this person drives the delivery of.

techLeadFor.label: Tech lead for teams
techLeadFor.description: The team(s) who own the systems this person drives the technical aspects of.

ownedTeams.label: Product owner for teams
ownedTeams.description: The team(s) this person is a Product Owner for.

deliveryManagerForTeams.label: Delivery manager for team
deliveryManagerForTeams.description: The team(s) whose delivery this person is accountable for.

ownedProducts.label: Product owner for products
ownedProducts.description: The product(s) this person is a Product Owner for.

dataOwnerFor.label: GDPR Data owner for systems
dataOwnerFor.description: The systems where this person is responsible for managing GDPR processes related to personal data.

technicalOwnerFor.label: Technical owner for systems
technicalOwnerFor.description: The systems this person has technical responsibility for.

stakeholderFor.label: Stakeholder for systems
stakeholderFor.description: The systems this person is a stakeholder for.

knowsAbout.label: Knows about systems
knowsAbout.description: The systems this person knows about.

teams.label: Teams
teams.description: The teams this person is a member of.

okrLink.label: OKR Link
okrLink.description: A url linking to this person's Objectives & Key Results.

types.name: Product
types.description:
Anything sold by the FT for use by an external entity,
or produced by an area of FT technology to be used by another internal area.

code.label: Code
code.description:
The unique identification code for the product. When creating a new product,
choose a lower case, hyphenated string similar to the name people call the product.

name.label: Name
name.description: The name generally used to refer to the product.

description.label: Description
description.description: Brief description of what the product is and why it exists.

serviceTier.label: Service tier
serviceTier.description: The service tier (level of support) given to the product.

primaryURL.label: Primary URL
primaryURL.description: The main url the product is served on.

dependencies.label: Direct dependencies
dependencies.description: The systems the product directly depends on.

recursiveDependencies.label: Recursive dependencies
recursiveDependencies.description:
The systems the product depends on, either directly or indirectly. This is
populated by traversing the dependency tree of each direct dependency,
and the list does not need to be manually maintained.

productDependencies.description: Products that this product depends on.
productDependencies.label: Product dependencies

productDependents.deprecationReason: Poorly named - superseded by better named option
productDependents.description: Products that depend on this product.
productDependents.label: Product dependents

dependentProducts.description: Products that depend on this product.
dependentProducts.label: Product dependents

dependentCapabilities.label: Dependent capabilities
dependentCapabilities.description: Business Capabilities that depend on this product.

types.name: Repository
types.description:
A source code repository. Should generally not be manually created as we have a
cron job that regularly syncs from github and bitbucket to Biz Ops

code.label: Code
code.description:
Unique code for this repository. Automatically created, it is a combination
of the type of system the repository is stored in e.g. github, bitbucket,
and that system's id for the repository.

name.label: Name
name.description: Display name for the repository, taken from the system it is stored in.

description.label: Description
description.description: Description of what is in the repository, taken from the system it is stored in.

url.label: URL
url.description: Web page URL for the repository.

systems.label: Systems
systems.description: Systems which the repository holds source code for.

packages.label: Packages
packages.description: Packages which the repository holds source code for.

versionControlSystem.label: Version control system
versionControlSystem.description: Version control system the repository is stored in.

lastSeenInSynk.label: Last Seen In Snyk
lastSeenInSynk.description: The date on which this repository was last listed in Synk as being actively scanned for vulnerabilities.

lastSeenInSnyk.label: Last seen in Snyk
lastSeenInSnyk.description: The date on which this repository was last listed in Snyk as being actively scanned for vulnerabilities.

vcsID.label: VCS ID
vcsID.description: The internal ID for the repository in the version control system that it's stored in.

sshUrl.label: SSH URL
sshUrl.description: SSH URL to checkout the source.

createdAt.label: Created
createdAt.description: The timestamp when the repository was created.

pushedAt.label: Updated
pushedAt.description: The timestamp when the repository was last pushed to.

projectName.label: Project name
projectName.description: The repository's project name (FT Bitbucket repositories only).

projectUrl.label: Project URL
projectUrl.description: The URL of the repository's project (FT Bitbucket repositories only).

storedIn.label: Stored in
storedIn.deprecationReason: The storedIn relationship is now replaced by the versionControlSystem property
storedIn.description: VCS provider that the repository is hosted by.

types.name: System
types.description: Any combination of software and technical infrastructure used by the business, engineering or operations.
types.moreInformation:
Systems are hierachical and represent the deployable units of our business. A Product may well be formed from a number of Systems each of which is itself formed from lower level Systems.
Examples of system include: FT.com Router, Content Annotator, Origami Registry, and Biz Ops Admin. Exmaples of products include: FT.com, Content API, Biz Ops, and Origami.
Systems are owned by Teams (not individuals) from either a delivery and support perspective (or both). A well managed productionised System will be linked to its Repository and its Healthchecks.

code.label: Code
code.description:
The unique identification (systemcode) for this system. Biz Ops is the source of
truth for system codes, so if the system does not yet have one, make one up -
a lower case, hyphenated string similar to the name people call the system is best.
Once assigned it cannot easily be altered, so choose carefully.

name.label: Name
name.description: The short name for the system which will be output on screens and reports.

description.label: Description
description.description:
A brief overview of what the system does and why, from the user's perspective.
Note that multiple paragraphs and other markdown features are not supported in this field.
Any technical details about how it works should be added in the [technical overview section](#technical-overview).

primaryURL.label: Primary URL
primaryURL.description: The main url served by the system.

systemType.label: System type
systemType.description: The system type (don't worry about entering anything here).

serviceTier.label: Service tier
serviceTier.description: The service tier (level of support) given to this system.

serviceType.label: Service type
serviceType.description: The type of service the system provides  (don't worry about entering anything here).

hostPlatform.label: Host platform
hostPlatform.description: The technology platform used to host the service, e.g. Heroku.

dataOwner.label: GDPR data owner
dataOwner.description: The individual responsible for managing GDPR requests for this system.

containsPersonalData.label: Does this system handle Personal Data?
containsPersonalData.description:
Personal data means any information from which an individual can be
identified directly or indirectly.
For Personal Data this includes: Full name and title, email address,
physical address, contact number, location data, online identifiers
(e.g. IP Address, cookies, MAC Addresses, pixel tags, account handles,
device finger prints, username and passwords), government identifiers
(e.g. passport, drivers license), signatures, workplace data (e.g.
salary/bonus/annual reviews), gender, date of birth.

containsSensitiveData.label: Does this system handle Sensitive Data?
containsSensitiveData.description:
Sensitive, or special category data, is a more regulated subset of
personal data, including race, ethnic origin, politics, religion,
trade union membership, genetics, biometrics (where used for ID purposes),
health, sex life or sexual orientation. We also include personal data
about children (under 16 years or age) and payment card information
in this category.
For more details, see the Information Commissioner's definition:
https://ico.org.uk/for-organisations/guide-to-the-general-data-protection-regulation-gdpr/what-is-personal-data/what-is-personal-data/.

piiSources.label: PII sources
piiSources.description: The systems that produce/store the PII data that is used by this system (other kinds of data flow do not need to be noted here).

piiDestinations.label: PII destinations
piiDestinations.description: The systems that consume the PII data that is stored in/processed by this system (other kinds of data flow do not need to be noted here).

canDownloadPersonalData.label: Downloadable personal data
canDownloadPersonalData.description: Does this system allow users to download personal data?

canContactIndividuals.label: Contactable individuals
canContactIndividuals.description: Does this system have the capability to contact individuals?

gdprRetentionProcess.label: Retention process
gdprRetentionProcess.description: The type of process used to handle GDPR data retention.

gdprErasureProcess.label: Erasure process
gdprErasureProcess.description: The type of process used to handle GDPR data erasure requests.

risk.label: Data - more information
risk.description: More details of what kind of data is held/processed in this system, and what the associated risks are.

lifecycleStage.label: Lifecycle stage
lifecycleStage.description: How far this system has progressed through its lifecycle from Preproduction to Decommissioned.

SF_ID.label: Salesforce ID
SF_ID.description: ID of this system in salesforce.

architectureDiagram.label: Architecture Diagram
architectureDiagram.description: A diagram of the system's architecture (either a link to one or embedded directly).

troubleshooting.deprecationReason: Replaced by firstLineTroubleshooting and secondLineTroubleshooting fields
troubleshooting.label: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.description: Guidance for troubleshooting problems with this system.

firstLineTroubleshooting.label: First line troubleshooting
firstLineTroubleshooting.description:
Troubleshooting information for members of the Operations Support Team. You can assume
- access to most applications and tools widely used at FT
- admin privileges for most infrastructure we run systems on
- familiarity with the command line and admin interfaces for our applications
In general, do _not_ assume any familiarity with the system's source code.

secondLineTroubleshooting.label: Second line troubleshooting
secondLineTroubleshooting.description: Troubleshooting information for members of the system's support or delivery team.

monitoring.label: Bespoke Monitoring
monitoring.description: Details of any monitoring this system has.

failoverProcessType.label: Type of Failover Process
failoverProcessType.description: The mechanism used to achieve a failover.

failbackProcessType.label: Type of Failback Process
failbackProcessType.description: The mechanism used to achieve a failback.

failoverDetails.label: Failover Details
failoverDetails.description: The actions required to fail this system from one region to another. Either provide a set of numbered steps or a link to a detailed process that operations can follow.

dataRecoveryProcessType.label: Type of Data Recovery Process
dataRecoveryProcessType.description: The mechanism used to achieve a data recovery.

dataRecoveryDetails.label: Data Recovery Details
dataRecoveryDetails.description: The actions required to restore the data for this system. Either provide a set of numbered steps or a link to a detailed process that operations can follow.

releaseProcessType.label: Type of Release Process
releaseProcessType.description: The mechanism used to achieve a release.

rollbackProcessType.label: Type of Rollback Process
rollbackProcessType.description: The mechanism used to reverse a release.

releaseDetails.label: Release Details
releaseDetails.description: The actions required to deploy a new version of this system. Either provide a set of numbered steps or a link to a detailed process that operations can follow.

credentialsRefreshProcessType.label: Type of Credentials Refresh Process
credentialsRefreshProcessType.description: The mechanism used to achieve a change in credentials.

credentialsRefreshDetails.label: Credentials Refresh Details
credentialsRefreshDetails.description: The actions required to change the credentials used by this system. Either provide a set of numbered steps or a link to a detailed process that operations can follow.

keyManagementProcessType.label: Type of Key Management Process
keyManagementProcessType.description: The mechanism used to create/rotate keys.

keyManagementDetails.label: Key Management Details
keyManagementDetails.description: The actions required to create/change the keys used by this system. Either provide a set of numbered steps or a link to a detailed process that operations can follow.

moreInformation.label: More Information
moreInformation.description: Any additional information about this system.

architecture.label: Architecture
architecture.description:
Brief description of the system's architecture.
It's recommended that one or more diagrams are included here.
Please include link(s) to where the diagrams can be edited.

repositories.label: Source code repositories
repositories.description: The repositories which store this system's source code and/or configuration.

healthchecks.label: Healthchecks
healthchecks.description: Healthchecks which are used to monitor this system.

deliveredBy.label: Delivered by team
deliveredBy.description:
The team which delivers the system. Costs related to this system will be allocated to the
Group this Team is a part of.

supportedBy.label: Supported by team
supportedBy.description: The team which supports the system.

technicalOwner.label: Technical owner
technicalOwner.description:
The individual responsible for technical aspects of this system
(optional - if absent, assume the tech lead of the delivery team is
responsible).

stakeholders.label: Stakeholders
stakeholders.description:
People who have an interest in knowing about the status of or changes to this system.
Can also be used for people associated with the system who do not fit into the other, more clearly defined roles.

knownAboutBy.label: Known about by
knownAboutBy.description: People who have technical knowledge of the system, though may no longer work on it.

dependencies.label: Dependencies
dependencies.description:
The other systems this system directly depends on. In general, this means systems
that this system makes requests to, or that provide some sort of platform that
this system runs on. More exotic dependency relationships may exist, where it can
be hard to decide which way the dependency arrow points, but if either of the
conditions above describe the relationship between this system and the other
reasonably well, then the other system can be said to be a dependency of this one.

recursiveDependencies.label: Recursive dependencies
recursiveDependencies.description: The other systems this system depends on, either directly or indirectly.

dependents.label: Dependents
dependents.description:
The other systems which directly depend on this system. See the description for the
'dependencies' field for more details.

recursiveDependents.label: Recursive dependents
recursiveDependents.description: The other systems which depend on this system, either directly or indirectly.

dependentProducts.label: Dependent products
dependentProducts.description: Products which depend on this system.

dependentCapabilities.label: Dependent capabilities
dependentCapabilities.description: Business Capabilities that depend on this system.

recursiveDependentProducts.label: Recursive dependent products
recursiveDependentProducts.description: The products which depend on this system, either directly or indirectly.

installs.label: Installs packages
installs.deprecationReason: Replaced by installsPackages, which is clearer in intent
installs.description: The shared packages (libraries, components, toolkits, etc.) which this system installs and is dependent on.

installsPackages.label: Installs packages
installsPackages.description: The shared packages (libraries, components, toolkits, etc.) which this system installs and is dependent on.

stores.label: Repositories
stores.description: If the system is a VCS, the repositories it stores.
stores.deprecationReason: Of little value to model as a relationship; repositories will have a property on them detailing whether they are stored in bitbucket or github

replaces.label: Replaces systems
replaces.description: System(s) that are, or will be, replaced, at least in part, by this system.

replacedBy.label: Replaced by systems
replacedBy.description: System(s) that do, or will, replace all or part of this system.

lastServiceReviewDate.description: The date that Operations last reviewed this system.
lastServiceReviewDate.label: Last review date

sosTrafficLight.description: The Service Operability Score (SOS) given by Operations during their manual review of the quality of the information contained in this system as presented to them via the runbook.
sosTrafficLight.label: SOS Traffic light

lastSOSReport.label: Last SOS Report
lastSOSReport.description: A link to the Service Operability Score (SOS) report detailing the actions required to make the resulting runbook more usable by the Operations team.

herokuPipelineName.label: Heroku pipeline Name
herokuPipelineName.description: This is the name of the Heroku pipeline for this system. If you don't have a pipeline, this is the name of the app in Heroku. A pipeline is a group of Heroku apps that share the same codebase where each app in a pipeline represents the different stages in a continuous delivery workflow, i.e. staging, production.

updatesData.label: Updates data
updatesData.description: A set of governed data items that this system updates.

types.name: Tag
types.description:
A tag (or often called pixel) is a short snippet of javascript (code) that does something on a website.
In the context of marketing/advertising tags and pixels, they are often collecting some information about the
visitor to a website and their behavior on the site.

name.label: Name
name.description: The name of the tag which is the url.

provider.label: Provider
provider.description: Team/person or provider who set the tag.

description.label: Description
description.description: Short description of what the tag does and data it stores.

hasTagInstanceOf.label: Tag instance data
hasTagInstanceOf.description: Tag instance data for times Tag has been found on audit of product / domain.

main.heading: Main properties
main.description: These are all essential to fill out.

types.name: TagInstance
types.description: A node with Tag relationship data specific to a Tag attached to a domain/product website. Data includes the last seen date.

code.label: Code
code.description: Unique code for this record, an amalgamation of the tag name and domain it's found on.

resourceType.label: Resource Type
resourceType.description: Defines the type of tag, e.g image/pixel, script, document.

lastSeen.label: Date last seen
lastSeen.description: Date Tag last found during audit of product / website Audit.

product.label: Product
product.description: The product / website the tag is found on.

isInstanceOfTag.label: Tag details
isInstanceOfTag.description: Information about what the tag is for, taken from tagopedia or completed internally.

main.heading: Main properties
main.description: These are all essential to fill out.

types.name: Team
types.description: A group of individuals within the FT organisation or our suppliers who deliver and/or support one or more systems.
types.moreInformation:
Teams are structured hierarchically. Each team is either part of a Group, part of another Team, or a Supplier
Teams that are a direct part of Group are known as Higher Level teams.
Teams which are part of a another team are known as Sub-teams or Child teams.

code.label: Code
code.description:
The unique identification code for the team. When creating a new team,
choose a lower case, hyphenated string similar to the name people call the team.

name.label: Name
name.description: The short title for the team which will be output on screens and reports.

description.label: Description
description.description: A paragraph which explains the purpose of the team using terms that would be understood by all the FT.

email.label: Email
email.description: The email address to use to contact the team.

slack.label: Slack
slack.description: The slack channel to use to contact the team.

phone.label: Phone
phone.description: The phone number to use to contact the team.

isActive.label: Active
isActive.description: Whether or not the team is still in existence.

isThirdParty.label: Third party
isThirdParty.description: Whether or not the team is a supplier.

supportRota.label: Support rota
supportRota.description: A url linking to the rota the team use to identify which team members support their systems.

contactPref.label: Preferred contact method
contactPref.description: How the team would like to be contacted.

techLeads.label: Tech leads
techLeads.description: The individuals who drive the technical aspects of the systems owned by the team.

productOwners.label: Product owners
productOwners.description: The individuals who drive the business aspects of the systems owned by the team.

deliveryManagers.label: Delivery Managers
deliveryManagers.description: The individuals who are accountable for the delivery of products and services by the team.

parentGroup.label: Parent FT group
parentGroup.description: For teams that have a direct association with a Tech Director this field defines the Group the director manages; otherwise blank.

group.label: Associated Group
group.description: The group that owns the team either through a direct association or as a sub-team.

subTeams.label: Sub-teams
subTeams.description: The teams that are sub-divisions of this team.

parentTeam.label: Parent team
parentTeam.description: For child teams this field defines the team they are part of; otherwise blank.

delivers.label: Delivers systems
delivers.description: The list of systems the team delivers.

maintainsPackages.label: Maintains packages
maintainsPackages.description: The list of packages (libraries, components, toolkits, etc.) the team maintains.

supports.label: Supports systems
supports.description: The list of systems the team supports.

teamMembers.label: Team members
teamMembers.description: The list of people who make up this team.

governsAuditableData.label: Governs data
governsAuditableData.description: The data types that this team governs that values of. i.e. the team curates the range of values for a type.

okrLink.label: OKR Link
okrLink.description: A url linking to the Objectives & Key Results this team is currently focusing on.

business.label: Business
business.description: Relating to how the FT operates and makes and spends its money

technology.label: Technology
technology.description: Relating to the technology and infrastructure the FT uses

organisation.label: Organisation
organisation.description: Operational units of the FT e.g. teams, people

governance.label: Governance
governance.description: Elements of the FT that are in Biz Ops primarily for governance reasons

ProcessType.description: The means by which a procedure is delivered

options.FullyAutomated: The procedure is completed without any need for human intervention.
options.PartiallyAutomated:
The procedure requires minimal, easily repeatable human intervention to
be completed, e.g. clicking a button to start the process, following
a simple wizard
options.Manual:
The procedure requires non-trivial human intervention to be completed,
e.g. output of previous step requires analysis before deciding how to
continue the process. Even if some parts of the process are automated,
it should still be categorised as Manual (not PartiallyAutomated) if the
non-automated parts require such higher degrees of human intervention
options.NotApplicable:
No process defined, with good reason. If provided, please add details in
the free text area to explain why not.

options.ActiveActive:
The service is running and serving traffic in multiple regions during normal operation.
Failover is accomplished by turning off the unhealthy region and all traffic
is routed to the remaining regions.
options.ActivePassive:
The service only serves traffic from a single region, but has one or more standby regions
which can be quickly started (if necessary) and routed to instead.
options.NotApplicable: No failover procedure required - please add details in the free text area to explain why not.

TrafficLight.description: Quality rating based on Red, Amber and Green.

SystemLifecycle.description:
The lifecycle stage of a system.
Note that 'Deprecated' should be used for systems that are currently
not actively used, but may not be fully decommissioned yet

options.Preproduction:
Not yet ready for use. May be unstable, subject to unannounced changes,
or not yet fully built.
options.Production: Ready for use by its intended users, and supported appropriately.
options.Deprecated:
In the process of being replaced or retired. May still be functional,
but should not be added as a new dependency to systems.
options.Discontinued: No longer functional. Attempts to interact with the system will be unsuccessful.
options.Decommissioned:
For a self hosted/installed system, all its parts have been removed from all the environments it ran in.
For SaaS, we no longer pay for or have the ability to use the system.

options.Unsupported: No availability target, no formal support
options.Bronze: No availability target, office hours support
options.Platinum: 99.9% availability, 24/7 support, runs in at least 2 regions

ProductLifecycle.description: The lifecycle stage of a product

options.Incubate:
Low investment.
Experimental with high failure rate.
Prioritise quick learning over fidelity and quality
Strategically aligned; financial ROI not expected
options.Grow:
Medium to low investment.
Working known lines of inquiry for modest KPI gains
Stable quality & SLA
options.Sustain:
High investment.
Experimentation combined with scaling and SLAs
Rising quality
Metrics moving more than 10%
Accountable for ROI
options.Sunset:
Low investment
No new features
Decommissioning begins

PersonSource.description: The main origin of information about a Person

PersonContract.description: Types of employment contract a Person may have with the FT

VersionControlSystem.description: Version control system that can store source code repositories

GDPRProcess.description: A process used for handling GDPR erasure and retention requests

options.AutomaticChasingEmail:
Auto-generated emails sent from the GDPR Hub to System Owners,
instructing them to erase data for an individual.
options.DeletionTable:
Automatically reacts to entries in a table of people who need to be deleted,
maintained by the Data Platform and populated when they are deleted in Membership.
options.ScheduledPurge:
The system has a routine in place which deletes data older than a specified time.
The time varies by system but should not be longer than 30 days.
options.API: System has a delete APIs which is called directly by the GDPR Hub.
options.Manual: No automated routine in place for deletions.
options.Multiple: Uses a variety of the methods listed above.
options.NotApplicable:
System is considered too complex to complete erasure/retention on.
The risks _must_ be agreed by the FT Legal and Compliance teams.

options.StrictlyNecessary:
These cookies are essential in order to enable you to move around the website
and use its features, such as accessing secure areas of the website. Without
these cookies services you have asked for, like shopping baskets or e-billing,
cannot be provided.
options.Performance:
These cookies collect information about how visitors use a website, for instance
which pages visitors go to most often, and if they get error messages from web pages.
These cookies dont collect information that identifies a visitor. All information
these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. It is only used to
improve how a website works.
options.Functionality:
These cookies allow the website to remember choices you make (such as your user
name, language or the region you are in) and provide enhanced, more personal
features. For instance, a website may be able to provide you with local weather
reports or traffic news by storing in a cookie the region in which you are
currently located. These cookies can also be used to remember changes you have
made to text size, fonts and other parts of web pages that you can customise.
They may also be used to provide services you have asked for such as watching
a video or commenting on a blog. The information these cookies collect may be
anonymised and they cannot track your browsing activity on other websites.
options.TargetingOrAdvertising:
These cookies are used to deliver adverts more relevant to you and your interests
They are also used to limit the number of times you see an advertisement as well
as help measure the effectiveness of the advertising campaign. They are usually
placed by advertising networks with the website operators permission. They remember
that you have visited a website and this information is shared with other organisations
such as advertisers. Quite often targeting or advertising cookies will be linked
to site functionality provided by the other organisation.

TagPurpose.description: The purpose of a tag or pixel

CapabilityTier.description: Level of importance of a business capability

options.BrandCritical:
Failure to be able to execute this capability risks long-term damage to the FT
e.g. publishing content to ft.com
options.BusinessCritical:
Failure to be able to execute this capability risks significant short-term damage
to the FT and its sources of revenue which are difficult to rectify, even after
the capability has been restored e.g. processing subscriptions
options.NotCritical:
Failure to be able to execute this capability, although harmful to the FT, can
be managed, and any damage is temporary and generally possible to rectify after the
capability has been recovered e.g. producing a monthly financial report
